    • Method Detail

      • addPlug

        public boolean addPlug​(char end1,
                       char end2)
        Add the new Plug to the ArrayListmyPlugboard. Each element from the ArrayList is selected using an IteratorreturnIterator() and clashes Plug.classesWith(Plug) are checked against the new Plug(created using the two sockets passed as parameters: end1, end2
        Parameters:
        end1 - First Socket of the Plug
        end2 - Second Socket of the Plug
        Returns:
        boolean FALSE if there is a clash with an already existing Plug TRUE if there is no clash

      • clear

        public void clear​()
        Remove all the Plugs from the ArrayList

      • getNumPlugs

        public int getNumPlugs​()
        Get the total number of Plugs in the ArrayList
        Returns:
        int the number of Plugs already connected

      • getPlugs

        public java.util.ArrayList<Plug> getPlugs​()
        Return the plugs connected to the Plugboard
        Returns:
        The Plugs connected in the current Plugboard

      • returnIterator

        public java.util.Iterator returnIterator​()
        Return an Iterator without exposing the list
        Returns:
        Iterator

      • setPlugboard

        public void setPlugboard​(java.util.ArrayList<Plug> inputPlugs)
        Set the Plugboard of the current object to the Plugboard passed as parameter
        Parameters:
        inputPlugs - passed Plugboard

      • substitute

        public char substitute​(char newChar)
        Each element from the ArrayList is selected using an IteratorreturnIterator().Each of the sockets of the Plug is compared with the input char newChar and if there is a match the corresponding end is returned using Plug.encode(char), otherwise the input char is returned
        Parameters:
        newChar - the letter to be substituted
        Returns:
        char the encoded letter
